answers.text: to use the Cantabrian mountains as a place of refuge and protection from the invading Moors

qas.question: Against which group of people was Pelayos fighting?
In which battle did Pelayos defeat the Moors?
In which year was Pelayos proclaimed king?
What was the war of Christian reconquest, started by Pelayos, known as in Portugese?

context: Pelayos' plan was <a0_0>to use the Cantabrian mountains as a place of refuge and protection from the invading Moors<a0_0/>. He then aimed to regroup the Iberian Peninsula's Christian armies and use the Cantabrian mountains as a springboard from which to regain their lands from the <a1_0>Moors<a1_0/>. In the process, after defeating the Moors in the <a2_0>Battle of Covadonga<a2_0/> in <a3_0>722 AD<a3_0/>, Pelayos was proclaimed king, thus founding the Christian Kingdom of Asturias and starting the war of Christian reconquest known in Portuguese as the <a4_0>Reconquista Cristã<a4_0/>.
